sen.e: Desaku, also referred to as Detsukuri (literally going out to plow) means that inhabitants in a region cultivate the fields in other regions.

sen.e: This phenomenon was often observed during ancient times and the Middle Ages, when the rights of a legal land owner and an actual lord of the land were intricated and unstable.

sen.j: しかし、堺相論などが盛んになると、それは領民と土地の一元支配を名目として支配地域拡大を図る居住地側領主と耕作者の取り込みを図る耕作地側領主による対立の一因となった。
